item.title: Lula says Trump “is not the sheriff of the world” and threatens reciprocal tariffs in Brazil
item.description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva yesterday criticized his US counterpart, Donald Trump, who “is not the sheriff of the world,” according to Lula, threatening to react with “reciprocity” to US tariffs on Brazilian steel imports. At a press conference yesterday in Tokyo, during his state visit, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said that Brazil has "two decisions to make" in response to 25 percent rates that came into force this month: the first is to resort to the World Trade Organization (WTO) and, if it does not work, "resort to other tools". Lula specifically mentioned the option of “increasing tariffs on American products” imported by Brazil, which defined as “putting into practice the law of reciprocity”. "What we can't do is be silent, thinking that only they can impose tariffs," he said. "I am very concerned about US government policy because of these rates on all products from all countries," Lula told the press in Tokyo at the end of his visit when asked about the new 25 percent tariffs on all US imported cars from April 2, announced the day before Trump. "I am concerned because free trade is being harmed, because multilateralism is being defeated, and I am concerned because the American president is not the sheriff of the world, he is only the president of the United States," said the Brazilian leader. Instead of imposing “unilateral measures”, Lula considers that it would be more appropriate to “talk to other leaders” to reach a beneficial price policy agreement for all parties. "Honestly, I don't know the benefit of increasing tariffs on the cars bought in Japan," said the Brazilian leader of Asian country, one of the most affected by new commercial measures in the United States, given the weight of his automotive industry. "The only thing this is going to do is to make cars more expensive for US consumers and increase inflation," said Lula, who also pointed out the risk of higher prices leading to economic contraction. Leaders according to Lula arrived in Japan on Monday for a four-day state visit, which ended yesterday, before going to Vietname, where he is expected to meet Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh, and Vietnamese President Luong Cuong. In a summit held the day before Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, the two leaders agreed to launch joint decarbonization initiatives and reinforce commercial ties, with a future free trade agreement between the Asian country and Mercosur on the horizon and the current context of commercial war and climate negationism. During the visit, the Brazilian president stressed the message that democracy, free trade and multilateralism are in danger worldwide in the face of increased protectionism, authoritarianism, and the “new cold war” between the United States and China.

item.title: PJ | Goldsmiths were facade for money exchanges
item.description:
The Judicial Police dismantled two criminal groups of illegal money exchange on Tuesday. Of the largest group, which used eight goldsmiths as a facade were arrested 33 people, seized 18 million dollars from Hong Kong. PJ estimates that the group, which has been operating since 2019, will have changed funds equivalent to 590 million Patacas
The Judicial Police (PJ) dismantled two criminal groups on Tuesday who were dedicated to changing Renminbis to Hong Kong dollars. The largest case, which was the focus of a PJ press conference yesterday, concerns a group that had been operating since 2019. Authorities have detained 33 people, 22 local and 11 residents of China, and seized about 18 million dollars from Hong Kong (HKD) in cash, some game sheets, 48 ​​electronic devices and 12 accounting and false transaction books that put the group's operations to the naked. Since the beginning of the scheme, which began in 2019 with advanced capital by the group's head, will have earned more than 20 million patacas in illegal profits following the change of money in an approximately 590 million patacas. According to details of the PJ investigation, quoted by the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the group wore eight jewelery located in the vicinity of Casinos no Cotai as a facade to exchange money to play at the gambling tables. The scheme was to find gamblers, lead them to stores where they simulated the purchase of products, with the transactions recorded in fake taping of jewelery to hide the illegal money exchange. In both directions The PJ added that the group in addition to offering Hong Kong dollars after receiving the bank transfer from players, if they were lucky at the game tables could resort to false jewelery to switch back to renminbis via bank transfer. Tuesday's operation mobilized about 80 criminal investigators, who separated among the various jewelery involved, as well as pledge houses, a office in a mall and several homes. It was added yesterday that the group had a narrow connection with a clandestine bank in the North Zone of the Macao Peninsula, which collaborated in operations in the transfer and circulation of money, with a view to escaping the supervision of the authorities. The group's profits were found based on the variation of exchange rates. Authorities have indicated that they will continue to investigate the source and flow of the capital and seek suspects that have not been arrested now. The PJ announced yesterday that it also dismantled another group of criminals dedicated to the same type of offense, which will have changed about 200 million HKD and found 1 million HKD in improper profits.

item.title: IAS | Smart Creche Funding
item.description:
The reasons for the cutting cut was not clarified by the government, which merely indicated that it was unable to reach agreement with the Zonta Club of Macau Association, responsible for the exploration of space, on “basic principle” and “important aspects of organization”
The Institute of Social Action (IAS) will cut the financing and recover the installed facilities and equipment of the Smart Nursery, operated by the Zonta Club of Macao Association. The information has recently been revealed, but is generating a wave of concern from parents, who fear for the future of children's education. The reasons that led to the end of the support of the government of the daycare center were not made public. In explanations to Radio Macau's Chinese channel, IAS has stated that the end of financing is not related to any problem with the daycare operation. However, IAS indicated that it was not possible to reach an agreement with the Zonta Club of Macao Association on the molds in which the financing partnership would continue to function, which is in force until August this year. The broadcaster also points out that IAS indicated that the lack of agreement aimed at “basic principle” and “important aspects of organization”, without further details, which was justified by the fact that the association could still bring the case to the courts of MSAR. SECURITY TRANSFERS While confirming the end of public funding for day care, IAS also assured the guardians to be available to help with children's transfers to other day care centers when the Smart nursery closes. The guardians were also informed about the outcome in question and the available options. The IAS has linked that there are enough vacancies for all children who will have to be transferred, including the mud, where the Smart day care center is located. Currently, IAS reported, the day care centers more than 80 children and about half will enter into kindergartens in the new school year. Despite the guarantees, during the Macao Forum program, several parents were concerned about having to transfer children in late August, when the closing is expected. US connections Smart is explored by the Macao Zonta Club Association, which according to the official portal of the day care center, has been an association linked to the international zone organization, since 2014. This is a non -profit organization founded in 1919 in the United States, which has as its mission the affirmation of women's professional role, through philanthropic, social and cultural initiatives. It has more than 30,000 members worldwide, between 1,200 associations in 67 countries and regions. At Macao, he currently has president Christiana Ieong and has the support of businesswoman Pansy Ho, as an honorary partner.

item.title: CCAC | WARNING FOR SITUATIONS OF POSSIBLE ELECTORAL CORRUPTION
item.description:
Commissioner against corruption, Wong Kim Fong, said that inducing voters to sign list of applications through benefits is electoral corruption. The statements arise after being claimed that an elderly woman was invited to sign a list for the elections while exchanging the Macau Pass card, among other suspected cases
Electoral corruption is not limited to the exchange of interests and goods for votes, or benefits to readers. At this stage, the constitution of lists for legislative elections, "if any individual uses benefits to induce voters to sign the application for the event organizer, or the event organizer or who receives benefits commits the crime of electoral corruption." The explanation was given by the commissioner's deputy against corruption, Wong Kim Fong, in a clarification session organized by the Legislative Assembly Commission of Electoral Assembly (Caeal) and the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC), on electoral procedures for legislative elections. It is recalled that recently arisen that one of the elderly woman who was invited to sign a list for the elections while exchanging the Macau Pass card in an association to participate in the Grand Prix of Consumption. It was also alleged that school teachers would have been requested by associations to collect signatures to set up candidates and that a member of an association has been required to collect a minimum number of signatures. About this last allegation of pressure to collect signatures, the president of Caeal, Judge Seng Ioi Man, said on Wednesday night that the commission sought additional information, "but to date, no response was received" Despite these suspicions, the president of Caeal revealed that by Tuesday no formal complaints had been filed. Beyond borders The CCAC representative also assured that arriving at the campaign phase, already with the lists defined, "will strictly fight illicit means, namely, fraud through threat, coercion related to employment, mistakes, violence, among others, to influence voter voting intention." During the clarification session, in which about 220 people participated, the issue of supervision for campaign activities organized in Hengqin was raised. Seng Ioi Man indicated that violations of the electoral law outside Macao are also likely to be punished, not directly mentioning the deepened cooperation zone, in statements quoted by the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. Through police and judicial cooperation, the president of Caeal refers to effective mechanisms to combat violations of the electoral law outside the territory of the MSAR. Seng Ioi Man asked the population to denounce suspicions of electoral corruption or other irregularities, with “detailed and concrete information, including the form of direct personal contact”, so that Caeal and the law enforcement agencies focus efforts on tracking and investigating complaints. It is recalled that the election campaign will take place between August 30 and September 12, and residents go to the polls on September 14 to choose the cast of deputies elected directly to the Legislative Assembly.

item.title: Haião | Sam Hou Fai calls for reinforcement of cooperation with hengqin
item.description:
The Chief Executive went through Haião to participate in the annual conference of the Boao Forum for Asia 2025, and had a meeting with the Secretary of the Communist Party Provincial Committee of China, who suggested reinforcing cooperation between Haião and Hengqin
The Chief Executive requested the reinforcement of cooperation between the cooperation zone in Hengqin and the Haião Free Commerce Port. The proposal was presented to the Secretary of the Provincial Committee of Haião of the Communist Party of China and president of the Permanent Committee of the Provincial Popular Assembly, Feng Fei, at a meeting on Wednesday. According to the official version of the meeting, Sam Hou Fai said he was "very happy to see the progress obtained by the creation of Haião's Free Commerce Port." The province that is located on an island is regularly regarded as Hawaii de China, and is one of the major Chinese tourism centers, as well as having a preferential regime at the level of tax payment. During the meeting, Sam Hou Fai "underlined the deep and long time between the two regions", and "the good base of cooperation between the two parts in the sectors of tourism, health and education." At the level of future partnerships, the Chief Executive said there is room to reinforce cooperation through Mountain Island, since "Hungqin's cooperation zone and Haião's free trade port have identical political aspects." The resemblance is not surprising, as the two zones are part of the interior jurisdiction. Sam stressed that these similarities can “enhance the […] unique advantages, widening the exchange of cooperation” between the regions “for mutual benefits”. About Macao, Sam indicated that he is "accelerating with determination the impetus to the proper and diversified development of the economy" to achieve "high quality growth of society and the economy." Macao's government leader also said he was “an expectant of development opportunities through pragmatic cooperation between the two regions”. Hengqin as a reference In turn, Feng FEI indicated that the Haião Free Commerce Port will enter this year in operation as an autonomous customs zone and which was based on inspiration on the “several successful experiences of the Hengqin cooperation zone”. Feng FEI also pointed out that Haião will follow the development of the cooperation zone, to be inspired by the latest successes. The ruler also acknowledged that "the structure of the industries of Haimão and Macao have common aspects, where the proportion of the tourist sector is higher, hoping that both deepen cooperation, reinforcing the union for a new chapter of cooperation in various areas between the two territories." Sam Hou Fai was in Haião with a delegation from Macao to participate in the annual conference of the Boao Forum for Asia 2025.

item.title: MNE | BIR OF PORTUGUESE AND EPM are topics to discuss with Paulo Rangel
item.description:
During the visit to Macao of Portuguese Foreign Minister, Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to discuss the end of access to BIR access by Portuguese. The president of the House of Portugal in Macau associates this article with the position of Lisbon in the issue of 5G
It is another visit of a Portuguese ruler to Macau, but Paulo Rangel's first as Minister of Foreign Affairs of the executive of Luis Montenegro, at a time when the country is preparing to go to votes in May after the dissolution of the Assembly of the Republic. After a journey through China, Paulo Rangel will meet with local associative leaders in order to perceive existing problems related to the Portuguese community. At HM, Amelia António, president of the House of Portugal in Macau (CPM), argues that the difficulties of obtaining residence by Portuguese should be one of the pressing matters. “My expectation is not high. I would like the Minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the positions of the European Union (EU) so fierce, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. of the EU, and this should not be lost sight of. ” Amelia António highlights the position that Portugal adopted in the case of Rede 5G and Huawei, but also “the development that occurred in relation to the coming of Portuguese to Macau, subject to Blue Card”. “I have the feeling that everything comes following this EU policy against China. Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. "We are here, we suffer the consequences of these relationships [between Portugal and China], good or bad. We had very close relations for a long time, which changed with Covid. I have not seen things again as they were, and I think it was important that Mr. Minister explains what is the position," he said that Portugal does not have to "align faithfully with everything in Europe and, above all," Before the pandemic, he recalled the official, there was “permanent communication” and “much exchange” between the Portuguese and Chinese authorities. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in macao immigration, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this removal” between China and the West. Macao authorities have not accepted new requests for residence in the territory for Portuguese for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing for justification of family reunion or previous connection to the territory. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. "I would like the Government of the Portuguese Republic to take into account the Portuguese community in the territory, which faces some difficulties regarding the possibility of obtaining the residence. It is a topic that may be addressed between the Portuguese State and the MSAR, so that there is greater flexibility to allow the Portuguese community to have greater accessibility to the right of residence, as existed before." For the causal, "Misrere does not have to randomly assign more homes, but it is something that corresponds only to my desire." "Of course, that Mand has its reasons and Macau is different, and there are other communities that are interested in staying in the territory. The Portuguese community, due to greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still another community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It is a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In choosing correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one of green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work badly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December a pilot electronic voting experience in the circles of emigration. The head of Portuguese diplomacy arrives in Macau today after passing by Beijing and Haikou, in the province of Haião, where he was present at the Boao Forum. In Macao, Paulo Rangel has scheduled meetings with the head of local government, Sam Hou Fai, as well as the counselors of the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Visit the EPM and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, MNE goes to Hong Kong to visit “Lusas Stories”, an exhibition dedicated to the Portuguese community at the Hong Kong History Museum. Lame

item.title: Letters Route | Lusophony and literature highlighted this weekend
item.description:
This weekend is the Literary Festival Rota das Letras, but that does not mean a decrease in events. The literary universe and Lusophony will be prominent in the coming days. Today, there is the presentation of António Costa e Silva's book “Disconseguiram Angola”, but there will be more works of works and a session facing the children's book with Local Mandarina publisher
Another edition of the Rota das Letras Literary Festival is coming to an end which this year brought to the Lusophony Reflections and the Portuguese Decolonization Process. But regarding Lusophony, especially in the literary aspect, this will be prominent in the various events of the poster of the coming days. Today, precisely, the presentation of the novel “DISCONSEGURE Angola”, by António Costa e Silva, former Minister of Economics and Sea in Portugal. The session takes place in the former Municipal Slaughterhouse, in Barra, the "House" of Rota das Letras this year, from 18:30. “They disregarded Angola” is a romance that “the descent to the horrors of the war” and that, in the first phase, went to the newsstands signed with a pseudonym, but António Costa e Silva eventually assumed his own. With the seal of war and peace, it is a work that has "several books," with stories such as "the imagined return to childhood, life and stories of Luanda, the ancestral rivers of Africa and the war." There is, therefore, “a crossing of paths under the scene of war, the longest in Angola's history, which marked the country, the people, the words,” describes the synopsis of the work. Also in the old municipal slaughterhouse, in Barra, but in another room, at the same time, Rota das Letras hosts the dialogue session “Literature and Climate-Stories that change society”, with the presence of Jane Lee. This is an English session. In the same place, but from 7:30 pm, the world of Lusophony is again felt with the lecture “Lusophone Literature-a new world, half a century after independence”, again with the contribution of António Costa e Silva and Portuguese writer Djaimilia Pereira de Almeida. This is the author of several books, such as "Three Stories of Forgetfulness" and "This Hair" and "All Wound is a beauty," this last winner of the Romance Grand Prix and soap opera Ape/DGLAB 2024. His books and rehearsals have received various awards, including the Oceans award, and are translated into ten languages. In 2023, Djaimilia received the Flul Alumni award, awarded by the Faculty of Letters of the University of Lisbon, where he doctor. This year received the Vergílio Ferreira award, awarded by the University of Évora, by the whole of his literary work. He taught in New York University and is still a chronicler in several newspapers. Born in Luanda. Also from 7:30 pm, another book presentation session with Marina Pacheco, entitled “Living, Loving, Longing Lisbon - Tales of a Great City”, will take place. Essentially this work reveals stories of the Portuguese capital, bringing together small tales based on reports of residents and visitors of the city, as well as people who simply fell in love with Lisbon and its essence. Other voices The poster continues tomorrow afternoon with the lecture “Intelated Borders - Me and in the Women's Writing”, which takes place from 15h also in the former Municipal Slaughterhouse. This is a Chinese session with authors Kwok Yim Mei and Chen Xiaoyang, with simultaneous English translation. In another room, you change your language and theme: it is time to talk about the “Portuguese Kitchen of Discoveries”, with Anabela Leal de Barros, an author linked to the East and professor at the University of Minho. In addition to the dedication to the study of Portuguese baroque poetry based on the handwritten tradition, Anabela Leal de Barros has developed studies on the codices of different eras and spots, including those in the history of food, history of medicine, history of economics and, in particular, linguistic historiography and missionary linguistics. The theme of gastronomy continues, from 16h, with the presentation of “A China in Sete Banquets - an aromatic trip for 5,000 years of Chinese gastronomic heritage”, a work by Thomas Dubois. Manifest Also tomorrow, from 4 pm, it is the turn to talk about Fernando Pessoa, one of the great Portuguese poets, with the session "" I'm empty ". The heteronyms of person and the poetic translation", with the presence of Yang Zi. From 17h, there is another book presentation, also in the old municipal slaughterhouse, with the “Lin-Tchi-Fá. The Lotus Flower translated into Chinese and English 100 years after the first edition”, with Lian Zimo and Ian Watts. The universe of classical Chinese culture will be the subject of the session that starts at 18h, with the presence of Carlos Morais José, director of HM, and Zerbo Freire, translator. In this lecture there is talk of “The Weight of Autumn in the Heart, Li Qingzhao”, as well as the 9th issue of Via do Meio magazine, with the theme of “Chinese symbolisms”. Saturday night ends with music and poetry: from 8:30 pm, takes place at the D. Pedro V the show with the Lisbon Poetry Orchestra group, "The Myth of Writing, followed by" The Surrealists ". “Surrealists” is no more than a CD book dedicated “to a group of artists and poets who, in a gray Portugal, realized the urgency of freedom”, that is, the founders and followers of Portuguese surrealism. item.title: BOAO FORUM | Beijing asks Asian countries to oppose protectionism
item.description: Chinese vice-master-master, Ding Xuexiang, yesterday asked “resolute opposition to protectionism” at the Forum dedicated to economic cooperation in the Asia-Pacific region. "Asia has become the world's most dynamic region in terms of development and growth potential," said Ding Xuexiang, vice-Chinese-prime minister, in his intervention at the event, which was attended by Portuguese Foreign Minister Paulo Rangel. "Asia has actively opened its doors and took the initiative to integrate into the world," said the Chinese official, in a period of growing commercial frictions the United States and the rest of the world. Ding Xuexiang stated that the region should “work together to protect free trade, adhere to open regionalism and resolutely oppose commercial and investment protectionism”. He appealed to the “resolution of differences and differences through dialogue and consultation” and defended “opening, cooperation and economic globalization” as “inevitable choices” for the region. The deputy minister said China's economic performance “remains stable” and that “industry growth rates, consumption, investment and other indicators in the first two months of this year were higher than those last year”. Ding said authorities “will implement more pro-active macroeconomic policies” and “expand internal demand on all fronts” at a time when weak domestic consumption raises deflationary pressures in the second largest economy in the world. The leader added that the Chinese government will "promote the healthy development of real estate and scholarship more vigorously." The forum, which runs until Friday under the theme “Asia in a change world: towards a shared future,” said the resilience of the region in a global environment marked by geopolitical tensions.

item.description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva yesterday criticized his US counterpart, Donald Trump, who “is not the sheriff of the world,” according to Lula, threatening to react with “reciprocity” to US tariffs on Brazilian steel imports. At a press conference yesterday in Tokyo, during his state visit, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said that Brazil has "two decisions to make" in response to 25 percent rates that came into force this month: the first is to resort to the World Trade Organization (WTO) and, if it does not work, "resort to other tools". Lula specifically mentioned the option of “increasing tariffs on American products” imported by Brazil, which defined as “putting into practice the law of reciprocity”. "What we can't do is be silent, thinking that only they can impose tariffs," he said. "I am very concerned about US government policy because of these rates on all products from all countries," Lula told the press in Tokyo at the end of his visit when asked about the new 25 percent tariffs on all US imported cars from April 2, announced the day before Trump. "I am concerned because free trade is being harmed, because multilateralism is being defeated, and I am concerned because the American president is not the sheriff of the world, he is only the president of the United States," said the Brazilian leader. Instead of imposing “unilateral measures”, Lula considers that it would be more appropriate to “talk to other leaders” to reach a beneficial price policy agreement for all parties. "Honestly, I don't know the benefit of increasing tariffs on the cars bought in Japan," said the Brazilian leader of Asian country, one of the most affected by new commercial measures in the United States, given the weight of his automotive industry. "The only thing this is going to do is to make cars more expensive for US consumers and increase inflation," said Lula, who also pointed out the risk of higher prices leading to economic contraction. Leaders according to Lula arrived in Japan on Monday for a four-day state visit, which ended yesterday, before going to Vietname, where he is expected to meet Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh, and Vietnamese President Luong Cuong. In a summit held the day before Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, the two leaders agreed to launch joint decarbonization initiatives and reinforce commercial ties, with a future free trade agreement between the Asian country and Mercosur on the horizon and the current context of commercial war and climate negationism. During the visit, the Brazilian president stressed the message that democracy, free trade and multilateralism are in danger worldwide in the face of increased protectionism, authoritarianism, and the “new cold war” between the United States and China.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Zhu Houcong (1507-67), Emperor Jiajing devoting a lot of his time to his own person, discovered the state's affairs, delegating them in the corrupt Yan Song (1480-1567) who, among other infamies, would have a recognized righteous man who denounced him in a memorial sent to the monarch where his resignation proposed. This is called this poet literate and painter Yang Jisheng (1516-1555). The animadversion he felt in the face of injustice, risking his life to tell the truth, did not allow him to falter. Late on the night of December 2, 1553, feeling grateful for so many things that life had given him, in a conversation with his wife, Mrs. Zhang, who installed him to avoid the conflict given the impossibility of counteracting Yan Song's power, he replied that this was the way he had to pay all the assets he had received, as he recalled in a chronological biography (Nianpu). And yet, like many celebrated literati, he had also suffered exile on the distant margins of the Empire. It was in the course of one of these days in 1551 that, moved by the beauty of a landscape, made the painting traveling along the roller coaster (vertical roll, paint on paper, 147.5 x 39.5 cm, sold on Sotheby's) where he reveals his scholarship in the art of painting the literati in which the painted figure tends to the abstraction and the accompanying poem. In front of the mountain, whose name can be translated as "the heavenly beauty," he writes: «The Tianhua Mountain is not too far west of the provincial city walls,/ which chases admire these climbing blue-peeled blue clutches and rocks of a red-red!/ Towers and pavilions settle to the mutant shapes of the descent and climbed the mountain,/ shadows of flags and shamelies up and down the trees. shining against the vision of the clean sky,/ clouds entering; One could catch one with the sleeve. Yang Jisheng made in this painting a literate traveling in a river on a vessel that is suddenly alerted by the boatman who with a staff points to houses nested on the mountain. As on an album page that signed Jiaoshan, "Pepper Mountain" (PAPER, 27 x 35 cm ink, sold in the auctioneer Nagel) represented a home hung on top of a mountain, would say the figuration of its search for a place in the world, which would after all to refuse it. In the night that preceded his execution he wrote a famous pair of verses, in a practice known as Juemingshi, "poem of a cut life", which seeks to make a brief reflection on the meaning of his own life: "Iron Shoulders, to carry the length and the way,/ the pungent hand to writing ingeniously."
