item.title: Apomac | Jorge Fão regrets lack of people to manage association
item.description:
APOMAC - Macao's retirees, retired and pensioners association goes to elections tomorrow with a unique list. Francisco Mannão competes again for president, Jorge Fão for the General Assembly and Daniel Mendonça to the Fiscal Council. Mannão suggests the creation of a “satellite city” only for the elderly and calls for pensions update
Increasing the elderly pensions would be "gold on blue." In the meantime, Francisco Mannão continues to fight for this and other flags designed to improve the lives of older residents, again leading the candidate list for the management of Apomac - Macao's retirees, retirees and pensioners association, which take place tomorrow. The list is unique and the faces have little or nothing difference from previous years: Jorge Fão continues to lead the General Assembly, while Daniel Mendonça competes for the Fiscal Council. There is only one new name in the position of Member of the Fiscal Council. "It is very difficult to find people available to do this volunteer work. Jorge and I would like to find someone who could replace us, because we are for a long time in this association. We are elderly, but we have energy. As long as we have strength on the legs to walk, we are walking and trying to do our best by Apomac," Francisco Mannhão told HM. Jorge Fão highlights the fact that Apomac has been about to celebrate 25 years since the foundation, noting that there is, in fact, a leadership problem that if not solved can culminate in the disappearance of the association. "We are not seeing the emergence of another list of younger and younger people, so that we offer our services for another term and so on, as far as possible. There is a leading problem at Apomac and in other associations. The Apomac issue is more serious, because we have been standing for 24 years, we will celebrate in May." Satellite city and pensions In a list that will lead the association by 2028, the motto is “we are elderly but energetic”, reads in the action program. At the first point, it is indicated that the team's objective is "to monitor the government's policy and the Macau Foundation, with a view to adjusting the needs of our action program throughout this three -year term." In addition, they intend to "provide the necessary support to members so that they can enjoy the benefits awarded by the Government of MSAR and other official entities." One of the requests on the list to the government led by Sam Hou Fai is the increase in pensions, which is currently 3,740 patacas. It would be for the association would be the update to four thousand monthly patacas. "It would be good for the government of MSar to pay the pension monthly to the elderly, the pecuniary compensation and the old age, instead of having to wait every three months to receive the pension for the elderly, seven months to receive the pecuniary compensation and ten months to receive old age. Hm. Another idea left by Francisco Mannão is from the construction of a satellite city only for elderly dwellings, in what would be a larger project against residence for the elderly already built by the executive, in the area of ​​sand black. "I liked the Government of MSA to build a satellite city for the elderly. I worry a lot because there are many living alone, and with the construction of this satellite city they no longer have problems of loneliness, and could live with each other, and can provide services common to all. The construction of high buildings is good, but for the elderly it is not that good," he defended. Still, Mannão assures that being elderly in Macau is much easier than in Hong Kong. “Nowadays, in Macau, the elderly live quite well, because there are many social support attributed to this group of people. Sufficient resources Asked about the essential points to make Apomac a larger association, Francisco Mannhão says that “they have enough”, but lames the closure of the clinic where they were provided to the elderly health care. "Of course we had the plan to be able to develop our headquarters more, but due to the lack of the allowance we had to end our clinic. In this context, we had a program to develop this area that had to be abandoned, and that would benefit our associates. We tried to organize more lectures about health, because the senior group needs to know more about disease and health affairs, something that can generate great concerns." In political terms, Francisco Mannhão, who was even a candidate for deputy to the Legislative Assembly, says that Apomac is an advocate of the principle of “one country, two systems”, thought by Beijing to the regions of Macau and Hong Kong. "We agree with the national policy of 'a country, two systems', so that Macau can be a paradise for us. So far we have been quite well in Macau, we have no problems, but we would like this principle to continue." A lot of bureaucracy One of the services provided by Apomac goes through bureaucratic support to the elderly in communication with the General Retirement Caixa (CGA), in the case of former civil servants who receive the reform of Portugal, or the Macao Pension Fund. "The communication with CGA has improved a little, but the bureaucratic part is still very difficult to deal with on the part of our associates. Not long ago one of our associates has waited more than three years for an amount of an amount that was improperly charged," said Francisco Mannão. Jorge Fão, in turn, stressed that Apomac is also popular with non -partners, including from the Chinese community, to treat various issues, such as requests for subsidies or funeral -related paperwork. Still looking at the Action program, Apomac's list also aims to “organize more sightseeing tours to mainland China, making known its culture and success of the country”, as well as the promotion of “more coexistence, so that members join periodically”. Much sought after by the dining service, since in Apomac some dishes of macanese gastronomy can be eaten, the list wants to "improve the management of the canteen whenever possible." Asked if many elderly from Macau want to pass the renovation in China one day, at a time when regional integration is increasingly a reality, Francisco Mannão admits yes, although many “prefer to stay in the territory, as they have their life rooted here, being used to the uses and customs of Macao”. "The Government of MSA has been doing a lot of work so that they can join the great bay," he said.

item.title: BOAO FORUM | Ia, globalization and sustainability in discussion
item.description:
Another edition of the Boao Forum began in Haião, where topics such as artificial intelligence, globalization, current economic issues and sustainable development will be discussed. The head of the Executive of Masters departs today for the event, whose theme is “Asia in the world in transformation: towards a shared future”
Posters to announce another edition of the Boao Forum can be seen everywhere in Haião, the Chinese island that hosts the International Forum promoted by Beijing to discuss, with other countries, issues of economic, commercial and cooperation at various levels. The MSAR will be represented by an official delegation led by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, who will be on the island between today and tomorrow. Liu Xianfa, commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in the MSAR, continues to join the delegation of MSAR as a guest advisor. The official delegation of the MSAR is also composed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, and the chief executive chief of the cabinet, Chan Kak. During the absence of Sam Hou Fai, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, will interim the functions of Chief Executive. The Boa Goveal Forum for Asia 2025 ends on Friday and has as its theme “Asia in the world in transformation: Towards a shared future” [Asia in the Changing World: Tows a Shared Future], and, according to a statement released by the chief executive's office, focuses on four essential areas, one of them “rebuilding confidence and promoting cooperation in a rapid transformation world”. Objectives are followed by "encouraging growth and rebalanced globalization for inclusive development" or "modeling the future and rapidly implementing the objectives of sustainable development to respond more effectively to global challenges." In turn, the fourth objective concerns a very current area: Artificial Intelligence (AI). It is thus intended to “explore potentialities and intensify AI's application and governance for development motivated by innovation”. According to the People's Daily Journal, this year are expected for more than two thousand participants from 60 countries and regions, being held 50 forums, or discussion groups, around the above objectives. 1,140 journalists are expected to coverage the event. The forecasts of a forum The main conferences of the Boao Forum include discussions about the Chinese and World Economy, namely in "High-Level dialogue: China's reform and economic predictions" and "construction of an open world economy: challenges and solutions." Following is “Improvement of the construction of digital capacity & conforming the gap between digital”, as well as “unlock the great potential of regional free trade agreements”. Among the remaining panels are also conversations about the potential of AI in "AI: how to ensure a balance between application and governance." Countries will also address the issue of global governance in the relationship with the United Nations (UN), in "high-level dialogue: global governance after the UN summit of the future." But the discussion forums start with some predictions made in the report released in the context of the Boao Forum, entitled "Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress". One of the forecasts is that the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the Asian continent should grow 4.5 percent this year, reported Xinhua. "Despite growing global economic uncertainty, Asia remains a key growth engine for the world economy," the report says. In addition, in terms of parity of purchasing power, the Asia GDP ratio, within the world total, is expected to increase from a registration of 48.1 percent last year to 48.6 percent this year. In turn, the report describes that the general situation of employment and wages “is improving in Asia”, with an unemployment rate of 4.39 percent for this year, less than the global rate of 4.96 percent. The Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress also highlights foreign investments in Asia, describing that China and Asean-Association of Southeast Asia nations "are the most appealing economies in Asia." In addition, it refers that the dependence on the internal and external foreign direct and external investment of Asian economies in the region itself reached 49.15 percent by 2023. From the point of view of the bidirectional dependence of IDE in Asia, China continued to be the most dependent economy of the Asian IDE flows, followed by Indonesia, with its dependence rates over 80 percent and 75 percent, respectively. The report also pointed out that China remains the center of global production value chains, and since 2017, global trade in intermediate goods has been more dependent on China than in North America. In 2023, China's global dependence on intermediate goods was 16 percent compared to 15 percent to North America. The commercial friction caused by the United States in 2018 did not raise their position in the global value chains of the transforming industry, the report added. Thus, the advance of Asia is also described in the level of emerging green technologies, since this is "driven by strong industrial capabilities and political support." Thus, the continent seems to be positioning itself "as a potential leader in advanced materials related to batteries or production of biodegradable plastics." China, Japan, and the Republic of Korea dominate the Lithium Battery Battery Technology Global Supply Chain, a factor considered crucial for the electrification of transport, the report underlines. However, China is at the forefront of the expanding green hydrogen industry in Asia, being the region responsible for almost 70 percent of the worldwide capacity of hydrogen electrolisters, also reveals the same report. An ecological island According to an Xinhua report, Haião Island, which welcomes the Boao Forum, is “a pioneer in development with low carbon emissions”, namely the use of photovoltaic energy. "On Dongyu Island, in Hainan province, southern China, the almost null carbon emissions demonstration zone is redefining harmony between humanity and nature-remodeling modern life through the integration of cutting-edge technology with sustainable development," he describes. But there are more technological news, such as the use of "a simple QR code that unlocks a coffee carbon emissions experience, and where a robotic arm prepares coffee using clean energy." There is also the bet on recycling, as "an advanced recycling cube separates the materials, converting them into" carbon points ", which can be changed to ecological awards." The area that welcomes the Boao Forum has a total area of ​​190 hectares, where a bet on “three key strategies” was made, namely the “renewal of ecological buildings, use of renewable energy and ecological transport”. The renewal of the zone for more sustainable bets will have begun in 2022, being proof of “how technological innovation and urban renewal can shape a future with low carbon emissions, paving the way for sustainable development, particularly in the tropical regions of the world,” says Xinhua. Also according to the same report, "one of the main strengths of the area lies in energy production capacity", currently producing "about 32 million kWh of green electricity, almost double its search for 17 million kWh". In turn, "surplus energy is introduced into the network, contributing to an annual savings of 7 720 tons of negative carbon resources," he said to Xinhua Ouyang Qinglun, deputy director of the Cosco Shipping Boao Co. Department of Engineering.

item.title: History | Lara Reis, Professor of Macao High School, remembered in Lisbon
item.description:
The former teacher of the Macao High School Fernando Lara Reis was remembered in the “Spring Conferences”, from the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center, by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira. A native of Leiria, Lara Reis fought in the 1st World War and lived on Avenida da República, in the villa that today houses the Macau Red Cross house
Fernando Lara Reis was born in 1892 and died in 1950. Throughout a life filled with historical events and testimonies, the natural man of Leiria was a military man and a teacher at Macao High School, eventually making the territory his home. Lara Reis's life was recently remembered at the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira, herself to her former teacher in the territory. At the session, the historian, who won the 2024 Macao International Institute Identity Award (IIM), recalled the “Professor, meritorious, driver of the arts”, and owner of “unusual knowledge”. “He was a native of Leiria and lived in Macao until his death. He attended Leiria High School, the Military College, then joined the Army School. In World War I was in Elvas, and then left to Angola in 1915 when he faced the German threat over Portuguese colonies in Africa. Observer-Aviator. ” Lara Reis was never a pilot as she wanted, having dedicated much of her life to teaching and Macao. “In 1919, Lara Reis went to Macao High School. He took a long circum-gap trip, leaving Portugal from Lisbon, going to the United States of America, crossed the entire territory and then went to Japan, down to Hong Kong and even Macau. He was a teacher in Macao, drawing, handicrafts and gymnastics until the end of his life,” said Celina Veiga de Oliveira. The historian took to the session some written testimonies left by other Macao figures who wrote about Lara Reis, namely Monsignor Manuel Teixeira in the book “Macao Lyceu”. He said he never found "no teacher who had served the High School with greater dedication." “He was a rigorous methodical teacher, whose military formation was certainly not oblivious to these characteristics. What was truly standing out was his artistic vein, because Lara Reis was always concerned with ascertaining the aesthetic meaning of the students and opening their mental horizons. This at the time when Macau was a small town. that he organized and also exhibitions by Portuguese and foreign artists he sponsored, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira also highlighted the words left by the writer Henrique de Senna Fernandes in an interview on "one of the greatest qualities of Lara Reis", which "besides rigor and discipline, was the consideration by the students, not distinguishing rich from the poor." Professor Lara Reis was "a party prosecutor who served to obtain tuition fees for needy students," and "he is due to the initiative of the creation of the High School Association, of which he was the first president." This association organized in the former canhydrome “sports parties of the end of the year when students performed the most difficult exercises”. Work done in Macau The historian also highlighted “another aspect of dedication to territory” by Lara Reis. The Leiriense "participated in the First World War and this led him to interest all those who were incorporated into this conflict, having founded the League of the Great War fighters and had built in the cemetery of St. Miguel Archangel the monument where the bodies of combatants rest." Moreover, "another facet of his personality was a taste for travel, because he had no family and thus left for the world." "I visited museums, art schools and photographed everything I saw, having created a estate with 32 volumes that is now a heritage of Leiria." Celina Veiga de Oliveira did not forget the old “Sol Pente” villa, located in the middle-leaf zone, namely the Avenida da República, which was the house of Lara Reis, later donated to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao to “an anti-cancer clinic that was the first institution of the genre in the Portuguese colonial space”. Today this villa serves as a house to the Red Cross of Macao, and on its walls you can find a stone with the following message: “In this building legacy by the Rotary Fernando Reis to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao, it was installed at the initiative of the Rotary Club of Macao the first anti-cancer fighting center on April 15, 1951.” “Change of Ares” When Fernando Lara Reis goes to Macao, political times are troubled, with the political agitation to be lived in China after the fall of the Empire and the Republican Revolution of 1911. "In the 1920s the nationalist shock waves lived in the Canton, which sometimes haunted the Portuguese enclave quiet, but never moved with everyday life. The Portuguese administration guaranteed a standard appearance, and the parties at Christmas, Chinese New Year, the religious festivities of the Catholic community and the Chinese population were habitual." Celina Veiga de Oliveira recalled that in the late 1920s, Lara Reis decided to transfer to Goa, a trip that would only accentuate her belonging to Macau. “In the late 1920s, he felt he was time to change his air and asked to be transferred to the Afonso de Albuquerque High School in Pangim, and was there between 1941 and 1945, taking the opportunity to know India, and met the whole country. Instead, with a graceful and already sick license, choosing Macau to be his last address, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira recordou também as palavras de Orlando Cardoso, que no artigo “Macau e o Oriente na vida de Lara Reis” falou do homem que se deslumbrou com Macau “a partir do momento em que, às 8 horas da noite de 23 de Outubro de 1919, avistou pela primeira vez o Farol da Guia, um pouco antes de se instalar no ‘New Macao Hotel’ e sorver de sentidos atentos os sons, os cheiros e as luzes desta porta of an immeasurable and fantastic Asia that he would describe to exhaustion. ” These Lara Reis testimonies are “in a remarkable set of travel books that lay virtually unexplored in all their research potentialities on the shelves of the Leiria District Archive”, and were investigated by Orlando Cardoso himself. In the same article, this one refers to a text from the newspaper “News of Macau” of January 17, 1950, about Lara Kings: “The Auster and Worsen Teacher; the tenacious and thorough tourist; the military who fought and consecrated the memory of those who fell in the field of struggle; the honest and firm friend; the lovely and humorous companion; social celibate that, despite this, did not disdain any opportunity to undo its gallants, always kind and inconsequential to any palm with a face that in the goto ”. Given the few studies that exist about Lara Reis and the estate he left, Celina Veiga de Oliveira left a suggestion: "May the CCCM get the detailed index of the Leiria Archive, so that the research is possible for any interested researchers."

item.title: MNE | BIR OF PORTUGUESE AND EPM are topics to discuss with Paulo Rangel
item.description:
During the visit to Macao of Portuguese Foreign Minister, Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to discuss the end of access to BIR access by Portuguese. The president of the House of Portugal in Macau associates this article with the position of Lisbon in the issue of 5G
It is another visit of a Portuguese ruler to Macau, but Paulo Rangel's first as Minister of Foreign Affairs of the executive of Luis Montenegro, at a time when the country is preparing to go to votes in May after the dissolution of the Assembly of the Republic. After a journey through China, Paulo Rangel will meet with local associative leaders in order to perceive existing problems related to the Portuguese community. At HM, Amelia António, president of the House of Portugal in Macau (CPM), argues that the difficulties of obtaining residence by Portuguese should be one of the pressing matters. “My expectation is not high. I would like the Minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the positions of the European Union (EU) so fierce, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. of the EU, and this should not be lost sight of. ” Amelia António highlights the position that Portugal adopted in the case of Rede 5G and Huawei, but also “the development that occurred in relation to the coming of Portuguese to Macau, subject to Blue Card”. “I have the feeling that everything comes following this EU policy against China. Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. "We are here, we suffer the consequences of these relationships [between Portugal and China], good or bad. We had very close relations for a long time, which changed with Covid. I have not seen things again as they were, and I think it was important that Mr. Minister explains what is the position," he said that Portugal does not have to "align faithfully with everything in Europe and, above all," Before the pandemic, he recalled the official, there was “permanent communication” and “much exchange” between the Portuguese and Chinese authorities. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in macao immigration, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this removal” between China and the West. Macao authorities have not accepted new requests for residence in the territory for Portuguese for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing for justification of family reunion or previous connection to the territory. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. "I would like the Government of the Portuguese Republic to take into account the Portuguese community in the territory, which faces some difficulties regarding the possibility of obtaining the residence. It is a topic that may be addressed between the Portuguese State and the MSAR, so that there is greater flexibility to allow the Portuguese community to have greater accessibility to the right of residence, as existed before." For the causal, "Misrere does not have to randomly assign more homes, but it is something that corresponds only to my desire." "Of course, that Mand has its reasons and Macau is different, and there are other communities that are interested in staying in the territory. The Portuguese community, due to greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still another community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It is a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In choosing correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one of green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work badly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December a pilot electronic voting experience in the circles of emigration. The head of Portuguese diplomacy arrives in Macau today after passing by Beijing and Haikou, in the province of Haião, where he was present at the Boao Forum. In Macao, Paulo Rangel has scheduled meetings with the head of local government, Sam Hou Fai, as well as the counselors of the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Visit the EPM and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, MNE goes to Hong Kong to visit “Lusas Stories”, an exhibition dedicated to the Portuguese community at the Hong Kong History Museum. Lame

item.title: Public Hiring | New regime “is on the good way,” says lawyer
item.description:
Marco Caldeira, a guest lawyer and auxiliary professor at the University of Lisbon Faculty of Law, argues that the proposed public hiring bill, under analysis in the specialty in Hemiciclo, is “on the good way” regarding the attempt to “promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization”. The theme was discussed last week at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center
The proposal of public hiring, currently under analysis in the specialty in the First Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL), was one of the topics addressed in the “Spring Conferences”, at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) last week. The author of the lecture, the lawyer and teacher Marco Caldeira, made praise for the diploma for his attempt to reform and innovation in many respects. "Although not perfect, the bill under discussion is justified by the need to update legislation that was approved four decades ago. It is a proposal that seems to point in the good way, with an effort to codify the regime, promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization," said the professor at the University of Lisbon Law School (FDUL) to HM. In addition, Marco Caldeira understands that the diploma, and the content proposed by the government, aims to "follow what are good practices adopted in Europe and the West in general." "It is also very commendable that the proposal was prepared following a serious and participated procedure of public consultation, which gave the opportunity to economic operators and contracting entities to identify deficiencies in current legislation and make suggestions," added Marco Caldeira. At the CCCM session, the FDUL professor also pointed out that the concern [demonstrated, in the diploma] with the competition and transparency of the procedures ”, as well as“ the focus on training in the use of databases, as well as the focus on centralization ”. The teacher also understood that, in this bill, the Portuguese regime "can help, because the practice followed in Portugal, and legislative evolutions, have useful teachings that, with proper adaptations, can be transposed to Macao." Positive points In the presentation at CCCM, Marco Caldeira highlighted several positive aspects of the current law proposal, namely “the express determination of inapplicability to certain contracts”, or the fact that “fundamental principles of public hiring” are established. It is also required with the new law “qualifications to candidates and competitors” of public tenders, and there is also “the clarification and standardization of the types of public hiring procedures”. Thus, a “centralized hiring regime” is created, as well as regulating “award criteria” in competitions, and the creation of an exclusive website for the public hiring area is also foreseen. Marco Caldeira also drew attention to the real need of this diploma, as public hiring was legislated with various diplomas, including two decrees of 1984 and 1985, which established, respectively, the expenditure regime with works and service acquisitions, and the process of acquisition of goods and services. Such diplomas were “undone of reality” of Macao, even though the 1984 decree was reviewed in 2021, the teacher considered. Marco Caldeira also considered that the process of reviewing this diploma has been “lengthy”, as the public consultation took place between November 6, 2018 and January 4, 2019, and a later report was prepared, but the truth is that the proposal has been under analysis since December 2023, having been voted generally on January 11 last year. What has to change In the same session, the causal and university professor also highlighted the points already addressed by the first Standing Commission of AL regarding the necessary changes to legislate in the area of ​​public hiring. It was imposed “expressly consecrating fundamental legal principles, such as economy, efficiency and effectiveness, as well as publicity and transparency”, and there is also “a lack of regulation of public hiring policies”. There was also the “need to promote transparency in public hiring procedures” and ensure “greater protection of loyal competition”. There was also “lack of rigorous and explicit regulation on the composition and operation of the proposals evaluation committees” submitted to a public tender, and there is “lack of explicit demands on the qualifications and capabilities of candidates and competitors in hiring procedures”. Other gaps point to “insufficient regulation and transparency in the evaluation and adjudication procedures”, or “lack of explicit regulation on proposals presentation with an abnormally low price”. It was still necessary to “improve the sanctioning and inspection regime”, as well as bet on “regulation that promotes the development of electronic hiring”. Says the executive Looking at the justification of the law proposal, submitted by the Executive to AL, it is read that one of the great reasons for his presentation was even the legislative dispersion that was verified and the misfit over the current reality. "The nuclear part of these diplomas was prepared in the mid-1980s, and has been in force for over 30 years. A significant part of the provisions of other legal diplomas already has an obvious divergence regarding the needs of Macao's current socioeconomic development, the efficiency of public administration management and the reinforcement of transparency and supervision," he reads. According to the executive, "given that public hiring involves the use of the public purse, it is essential to review these regimes in order to meet the needs of the society of our day." Thus, in this law proposal, “the process and regime of expenses and acquisitions of goods and services” are regulated, with some provisions of a 1999 law, as “the provisions related to the public works contract regime have a high degree of specialization and are still effective”. It is intended, with the new law of public hiring, to “guarantee justice, impartiality in the evaluation of proposals”, defining “expressly aid criteria and rigorously determining the rules of conduct of workers and members of the opening and evaluation of proposals” subjected to contest, so that “excerpt their functions impartially and entirely”. Thus, it is foreseen that “contracting entities must adequately publicize the informative elements related to public hiring procedures”. They are “those related to the public tender, the clarifications provided, the rectification of documents, the extension of the deadline for the presentation of proposals, the causes for non -adjudication, the decision to annul the procedure and the award decision”. In order to guarantee loyal competition, the government wants to ensure that all entities interested in participating in a competition have “the broader access” to all procedures, prohibiting “all acts, agreements or practices that can prevent, false or restrict competition”. Moreover, there is the “principle of impartiality”, which determines that “the program of procedures, book of charges or other documents, made by the contracting party, cannot contain any clause designed to favor or harm a particular interested party”.

item.title: Aviation | Maria José de Freitas regrets removal of panels from the airport
item.description:
The first attempts to establish in Macao airlines in the early twentieth century were approached by historian Célia Reis in the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center. The architect Maria José de Freitas regretted the removal of panels from Macao International Airport that told this same story
Between the departure of the plane and the entrance to Macao International Airport (AIM) was a corridor that told the history of civil and military aviation from the territory of the early twentieth century. The project of this area of ​​the airport is by the studio of architect Maria José de Freitas, which regrets the removal of the panels and historical information that were installed in 2013. The architect left this idea in an intervention after the presentation of historian Célia Reis about the history of civil and military aviation in Macao on Monday, on the occasion of the “Spring Conferences” that take place at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in Lisbon. “We decided to tell the story of Aviation in Macao in this corridor, with a great extent, although at the time there was little documentation about it. I discovered some information in a work by Luís Andrade de Sá. We collected texts and images and put it all on the walls of this corridor, and that was there for a while.” "With a new direction [at AIM], I was asked how I could prove that all these events had happened. I had documentation in Portuguese, but I had nothing in Chinese and English, and at a time when I moved to Portugal on vacation, I saw, when I returned to Macau, who had removed all the information and images from this corridor. This story is unfortunate," he added. The architect added that she would like the history of the early days of Aviation in Macao to be told in these same walls. "It would be important to realize where there is more information, so that they realize the history of aviation in Macao, which was a pioneer. There was, for example, an aviation hangar near the mud houses, and there are a series of references linked to the history of this land that should be made visible at the airport, in the rooms, for example. This story should be told and things should be placed in the right place," he said. Ricou plans Célia Reis, historian and teacher, is developing an investigation project around the early days of aviation in Macao and this was the theme that led to the “spring conferences” on Monday, with the session “Aviation and Air Navigation in Macao in the 1920s-a process of colonial innovation”. Célia Reis spoke of a time when aviation began to be important to China for security reasons, and also begins to be thought to Macau. In this process, there is a personality whose name is important, a Hong Kong -born Frenchman: Charles William Ricou, a engineering and aviation pilot. From November 1919 the possibility of “establishing an air career between Macao, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Philippines, Java, India” began to equate, from November 1919, the possibility of Macaoi, Shanghai, Java, India, "contacting local government entities to obtain facilities and agreements. Célia Reis explained that Ricou intended to form two airlines, the “Far East Aviation Company”, with “a much wider connection, reaching Manila”, and another to connect Macau, Hong Kong and Cantão, named “Macau Aerial Transport Company”. This company "was constituted in Hong Kong, with a capital of $ 50,000, and had as founding partners personalities from Macau, such as Humberto de Avelar, Rodrigues dos Santos, Francisco Nolasco and Francisco da Silva". The historian also said in the presentation that the idea "was to complete the rest of the capital necessary with low value actions so that they could be bought by all [the inhabitants] in Macao." "There is even the appeal of the company's board of directors for the Macanese to subscribe to capital, showing that the company was extremely important for the inhabitants of Macao, highlighting its patriotic value, of solidarity with progress," he added. "Several voices demonstrated at that time that the company's commercial success, at first, could be little or none, although it was thought that the company could have some profits, having the ability to transport the air mail. However, this transportation capacity would be extremely limited, as the number of mail objects to transport from Macau was 24 letters a day," said Célia Reis. At the time it was thought that Macau would be a pioneer, because "it would be the first territory the Early East to have an aviation company", something that would "bring more visitors and increase trade." The Government of Macao, then led by Governor Correia da Silva, "gives in to the company's appeals, granting various facilities, such as the permission to build a provisional hangar on public ground that was vacant or from sea access infrastructure." In addition, “exemption from payment of the fuel storage tax” was allowed. Thus, Macao even had hydroavião and 21 American airmen hired by the company. "It was considered that it was the largest load of air material exported by the United States of America (USA), all brought to Macao." Then the company tries to organize itself, "even asking for space on Taipa Island, designed to have definitive hangars, although provisional concessions have existed." In this context, he recalled the historian, "there were subsidies, a contract for the transportation of postal bags", to "allow a development of air navigation." Impasses to the end In May 1920, a new worldwide aviation convention emerged, to which Portugal adheres, which causes the “Macau Aerial Transport Company” to be nationalized. The project comes to advance, but quickly retreats. “The airline therefore accesses the condition of obtaining a subsidy, and having four aircraft available for military service in Macau, if necessary. The issue of defense was always present. There was then some disagreement between the conditions required by the company and those that the governor understood were necessary. In addition, the government of Macao needed the Lisbon authorization for the operation of the airline. Advance, and this one begins to negotiate with the company. But voices begin to emerge in Lisbon that will make things change. ” This is the idea that the US would be showing hidden interests through the establishment of the company. "[In Lisbon] it is fear that this is the found form of an American aviation company to settle in Macao, Portuguese territory, by different ways." First, Lisbon forbids, retreating in the negotiations, and the next governor, Rodrigo Rodrigues, "is not in accordance with the company, understanding that it will not be viable," which leads to the entire project and dialogue to be suspended. Célia Reis also pointed out that "the government of Correia da Silva has undergone several difficulties in these years, in terms of security", having occurred "very serious incidents in the relationship between Portugal and China". “For this reason, the governor considered that having airplanes was extremely important because, at this moment, China was also resorting to aviation. The authorities of Portugal, however, considered that the planes of Macao would be of no importance, comparing with the set of aircraft that would have China or even Japan. When permission for the constitution of the airline in Macao, Lisbon understands that the territory could have in a worrying situation and planes could have functions with planes Military, even if there were few, ”explained the historian. The project would fall, however, by land.

item.title: The garden of Almerindo in Timor-Leste can be watered from Portugal or England
item.description: The Garden of the Timorese Almerindo Fernandes in Lautém, 231 kilometers east from Dili, can be watered from Portugal or England, after the civil engineer applied new technologies to the agricultural sector. Almerindo Fernandes, 30, has a degree in Civil Engineering and for years has worked on rural road construction projects, but the 'animal' for agriculture spoke louder and today owns Timor-Leste's first 'smart farm'. In Lautém, Almerindo Fernandes has about two hectares of terrain, where he planted eggplant, tomatoes and other vegetables, which watering through an intelligent irrigation system that controls through a platform on his mobile phone. "It means that in Portugal or England we can water the garden with the mobile phone. It's the modern world, the world of technology, digitization. It's the opportunity to use technology, using the mobile phone to water my garden," he told Lusa. "It is a great opportunity to use technology to modernize agricultural productions," he said. With about 1.3 million inhabitants, the agricultural sector in Timor-Leste is vital to the economy of the country, but production is low and did not follow the growth of the population. According to the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization, more than 70% of the Timorese population lives in rural areas and most practice subsistence agriculture. Almerindo Fernandes started the activity in 2017 with the money he was sparing while working as a civil engineer and today sells his production to the school lunch program, the Armed Forces and the markets of his municipality. “So far it was a private activity, but the government is supporting the expansion of the project to the other municipalities of the country,” explained Almerindo Fernandes. The support was achieved after presenting the project to the vice-prime minister, coordinating minister of social affairs and Minister of Rural Development and Community Housing, Mariano Assanami Sabino, who eventually hired him as a specialized technician to bring the concept to the rest of the country. “The government recognizes the creativity of young people and all citizens who have creative initiatives. It is a great opportunity and the government is supporting the transformation of the garden into a youth formation center,” explained Almerindo Fernandes. In the garden, Almerindo Fernandes already has to work four people permanent and then hire others to plant, take the vegetables and do the maintenance, and at the same time gives training to young people who study agriculture. Now, according to the civil engineer, the garden also serves to do experiences to improve the system, that is, to make it more efficient and effective, with “little spent and greater performance”. "It is the principle of modernization, increased production, minimal cost is the purpose of the intelligent garden system and it is a theory we have to adapt to Timor to develop the country," he said.

item.title: MIECF | Deputy Minister guarantees that he stopped building coal centers
item.description: The Deputy Minister of Chinese Ecology and Environment, Sun Jinlong, announced yesterday that China has stopped building new coal centers, unlike in an academic report released in February. “We completely interrupt the construction of new coal centers,” said Sun, during the opening ceremony of the Macao's International Environmental Cooperation (MIECF) forum. item.title: CCAC | WARNING FOR SITUATIONS OF POSSIBLE ELECTORAL CORRUPTION
item.description:
Commissioner against corruption, Wong Kim Fong, said that inducing voters to sign list of applications through benefits is electoral corruption. The statements arise after being claimed that an elderly woman was invited to sign a list for the elections while exchanging the Macau Pass card, among other suspected cases
Electoral corruption is not limited to the exchange of interests and goods for votes, or benefits to readers. At this stage, the constitution of lists for legislative elections, "if any individual uses benefits to induce voters to sign the application for the event organizer, or the event organizer or who receives benefits commits the crime of electoral corruption." The explanation was given by the commissioner's deputy against corruption, Wong Kim Fong, in a clarification session organized by the Legislative Assembly Commission of Electoral Assembly (Caeal) and the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC), on electoral procedures for legislative elections. It is recalled that recently arisen that one of the elderly woman who was invited to sign a list for the elections while exchanging the Macau Pass card in an association to participate in the Grand Prix of Consumption. It was also alleged that school teachers would have been requested by associations to collect signatures to set up candidates and that a member of an association has been required to collect a minimum number of signatures. About this last allegation of pressure to collect signatures, the president of Caeal, Judge Seng Ioi Man, said on Wednesday night that the commission sought additional information, "but to date, no response was received" Despite these suspicions, the president of Caeal revealed that by Tuesday no formal complaints had been filed. Beyond borders The CCAC representative also assured that arriving at the campaign phase, already with the lists defined, "will strictly fight illicit means, namely, fraud through threat, coercion related to employment, mistakes, violence, among others, to influence voter voting intention." During the clarification session, in which about 220 people participated, the issue of supervision for campaign activities organized in Hengqin was raised. Seng Ioi Man indicated that violations of the electoral law outside Macao are also likely to be punished, not directly mentioning the deepened cooperation zone, in statements quoted by the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. Through police and judicial cooperation, the president of Caeal refers to effective mechanisms to combat violations of the electoral law outside the territory of the MSAR. Seng Ioi Man asked the population to denounce suspicions of electoral corruption or other irregularities, with “detailed and concrete information, including the form of direct personal contact”, so that Caeal and the law enforcement agencies focus efforts on tracking and investigating complaints. It is recalled that the election campaign will take place between August 30 and September 12, and residents go to the polls on September 14 to choose the cast of deputies elected directly to the Legislative Assembly.

item.title: About 1,100 people live in apartments for the elderly
item.description: Until March 7, almost 1,100 people lived in the elderly buildings, a type of public housing that can be leased by residents over 65 years. The information was revealed by the Institute of Social Action (AMI), in the latest meeting of the Commission for Senior Citizen Affairs. The commission gathered on Wednesday, and was attended by the secretary for social affairs and culture, LAM, which also heard that the 1,100 began to occupy the houses in the context of about 740 applications. Regarding other people's requests to move to the apartment for the elderly, IAS representatives, including President How Wai, pointed out that they are dealing with the processes received between January last year and February 14 this year. The following work include the evaluation of the candidacies received and their ordering, also taking into account the capacity of the candidates. Only people considered independent can apply for this type of public housing. However, the number of applications that are being classified and organized has not been indicated. Avoid isolation At the meeting, the identification of hidden isolation cases was also defined as a priority work. item.title: Haião | Sam Hou Fai calls for reinforcement of cooperation with hengqin
item.description:
The Chief Executive went through Haião to participate in the annual conference of the Boao Forum for Asia 2025, and had a meeting with the Secretary of the Communist Party Provincial Committee of China, who suggested reinforcing cooperation between Haião and Hengqin
The Chief Executive requested the reinforcement of cooperation between the cooperation zone in Hengqin and the Haião Free Commerce Port. The proposal was presented to the Secretary of the Provincial Committee of Haião of the Communist Party of China and president of the Permanent Committee of the Provincial Popular Assembly, Feng Fei, at a meeting on Wednesday. According to the official version of the meeting, Sam Hou Fai said he was "very happy to see the progress obtained by the creation of Haião's Free Commerce Port." The province that is located on an island is regularly regarded as Hawaii de China, and is one of the major Chinese tourism centers, as well as having a preferential regime at the level of tax payment. During the meeting, Sam Hou Fai "underlined the deep and long time between the two regions", and "the good base of cooperation between the two parts in the sectors of tourism, health and education." At the level of future partnerships, the Chief Executive said there is room to reinforce cooperation through Mountain Island, since "Hungqin's cooperation zone and Haião's free trade port have identical political aspects." The resemblance is not surprising, as the two zones are part of the interior jurisdiction. Sam stressed that these similarities can “enhance the […] unique advantages, widening the exchange of cooperation” between the regions “for mutual benefits”. About Macao, Sam indicated that he is "accelerating with determination the impetus to the proper and diversified development of the economy" to achieve "high quality growth of society and the economy." Macao's government leader also said he was “an expectant of development opportunities through pragmatic cooperation between the two regions”. Hengqin as a reference In turn, Feng FEI indicated that the Haião Free Commerce Port will enter this year in operation as an autonomous customs zone and which was based on inspiration on the “several successful experiences of the Hengqin cooperation zone”. Feng FEI also pointed out that Haião will follow the development of the cooperation zone, to be inspired by the latest successes. The ruler also acknowledged that "the structure of the industries of Haimão and Macao have common aspects, where the proportion of the tourist sector is higher, hoping that both deepen cooperation, reinforcing the union for a new chapter of cooperation in various areas between the two territories." Sam Hou Fai was in Haião with a delegation from Macao to participate in the annual conference of the Boao Forum for Asia 2025.

item.title: DSEDJ | Government wants young people to celebrate victory in the war against Japan
item.description: The Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) wants to see the young people of Macao celebrating the “80th anniversary of the victory of the Chinese people's resistance against Japanese aggression and world victory against fascism” and, therefore, will fund various activities in schools. The revelation was made by the vice president of the Youth Council, and director of DSEDJ, Kong Chi Meng, at the meeting that took place on Tuesday. According to the official statement of the meeting, financing fits the program for young people “looking for red roots” and has as recipients the local schools and associations. The representatives of DSEDJ also framed the financing of activities in the “implementation of patriotic education with young people and students in different aspects and forms” in the “continuous enrichment of the work content of patriotic education” and the “comprehensive dissemination of the social fundamental value of love for the homeland and Macao through attractive means”. item.title: Mountain Island | Complaints of obstacles to integration
item.description:
Long lines to cross the border, insufficient health services, non -recognized addresses and letters that never reach the destination. These are some of the problems of Macao residents in Hengqin, that Deputy Nick Lei expects the government to be able to resolve
Deputy Nick Lei states that there are many obstacles to ensure the integration of Macao residents in Hengqin, and asks authorities to take new measures to improve the situation. Heard by the Citizen Journal, the deputy linked to the Fujian community indicated as one of the main obstacles the lack of conditions to cross the border, which makes those who live in Hengqin, but work or study in Macau has to often face long lines, especially during holidays or in the edge hours. As a solution to this issue, the deputy proposes that Macao authorities coordinate with the hengqin customs to install automatic border calculations or inspection channels only for Macao residents, in order to increase the speed of border passage. Regarding the identified problems, Nick Law also points out that the Health Center of the new Macao neighborhood of Hengqin, which began operating in November last year, has no regular blood harvesting service. Another of the identified flaws is the fact that some drugs available in Macao are not in Hengqin. Health services in the neighborhood for residents of Macau are thus considered insufficient. Law even reveals that there were residents who had to come to Macau to receive the necessary health treatments as they were not available in Hengqin. Bureaucratic problems In the list of complaints that appears in the statements made to the Citizen Journal, Nick Lei states that several residents find difficulties when they have to declare the address on Mountain Island with public services or financial institutions of Macao. According to the deputy, it is often that Hungqin addresses are not accepted in local institutions as a resident recognized in Macao. Another frequent situation happens when the home on mountain island is recognized, but correspondence never reaches the destination. Law thus asks the authorities to ask the post office on the other side of the border to find a way to overcome this obstacle. On the other hand, law regretted that the measure of the interior authorities so that the macao enrolled cars authorized to circulate in Hengqin could circulate throughout the Canton province has not yet come out of paper, although announced. Nick Law understands that integration is a process that takes its time, but argues that these aspects should be improved quickly to attract more residents from Macau to Hengqin.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence in Macao Culinary
item.description: (Continuation of the March 20 edition) As the food industry adapts to new technologies, bosses take on new roles as curators of experiences rather than mere producers. The combination of human creativity with AI capabilities can lead to unparalleled gastronomic offers. The impact of AI on consumer behavior cannot be ignored. The emergence of mobile applications that use AI algorithms to predict gastronomic preferences can change the way residents and tourists experience food in Macao. Food delivery services, such as FoodPanda and Uber Eats that do not yet operate in Macao, use AI to suggest restaurants based on users' habits and preferences. This personalization increases customer satisfaction by presenting options that closely align with individual tastes. In addition, food sustainability is another critical area to which AI can contribute positively. In Macao, like in other regions, there is increasing sensitization for the environmental impact of food production and waste. AI can optimize supply chain logistics, predict demand and reduce excesses, leading to more sustainable practices. For example, algorithms can analyze seasonal trends to suggest menus that align with available ingredients, reducing waste and ensuring that customers receive fresh offers. Collaboration between food brands and AI development companies is also becoming predominant. Partnerships may arise with the aim of creating innovative culinary products that capitalize on AI data and knowledge. For example, collaborations between chefs and technology companies can result in products designed specifically for Macanese cuisine, combining traditional recipes with AI -generated recommendations for the purchase and use of ingredients. The future of AI in the gastronomic landscape of Macau is promising. With continuous advances in automatic learning and data analysis, we can expect even greater AI integration into kitchens. For example, kitchen robots that may replicate the accuracy of human heads may become common. These robots will be able to improve techniques such as cooking and precise emphasis, improving the consistency of food production. In addition, virtual reality and AI can join to revolutionize gastronomic experiences in Macao. Imagine that customers can participate in virtual cooking classes guided by top chiefs, learning how to prepare traditional dishes while exploring the integration of Ia in real time. These experiences would promote culinary education, maintaining the essence of heritage. In the light of such advances, the ethical considerations surrounding AI in the culinary arts should also be carefully analyzed. The question of the displacement of jobs due to automation is a pressing concern. As AI assumes tasks traditionally performed by humans, bosses and kitchen staff can see their functions evolve. The formation and improvement of competences will become fundamental to ensure that cooking professionals can prosper in an IMI environments. Educational institutions in Macao must respond to this need, incorporating culinary technology courses in their curricula. This initiative will prepare aspiring bosses not only to dominate traditional cooking techniques, but also to understand the role of AI in modern kitchen. By combining the traditional teaching of culinary arts with technology, the next generation of bosses can enjoy the best of both worlds. The use of AI in Macau cuisine means an important turning point in the way food is prepared, served and experienced. By improving operational efficiency and customizing gastronomic experiences, AI brings a new era of culinary possibilities. Influential heads like André Chiang are leading the process, demonstrating how technology can coexist with tradition. However, the authenticity of Macanese cuisine should be preserved as we adopt these innovations. By addressing this weighted integration, Macau can remain a vibrant gastronomic center, balancing the richness of his heritage with the exciting possibilities of the digital age. The interaction between AI and traditional macao cuisine is a reflection of broader trends in the culinary arts globally. The trip of mixing the AI ​​with Macau's cultural heritage is just starting, but has a vast potential to shape the future of food. Resistance to embrace it can mean stagnation, while opening to innovation can lead to a prosperous and dynamic culinary scenario in the future.

item.title: LIMITS OF WORK
item.description: On March 17, the Hong Kong Census and Statistics Department released data showing that approximately 12,900 people worked on digital food delivery platforms and other goods over the past year. 52.5 percent of these workers are between 15 and 39 years old, more than half are less than 40 and 24.2 percent over 50 years. 64.7 percent of respondents stated that this work is their main source of income, 61 percent receives less than $ 5,000 from Hong Kong (HKD) per month and 37.1 percent earns more than 15,000 hkd a month. 53.9 percent work less than 44 hours a week, 24.9 percent over 44 hours per week and 21.2 percent of these workers claim not to have a fixed time. 68.6 percent work only for a delivery platform every day. 91.3 percent of respondents say they have started working in this business because it is easy to enter, having a flexible working method and having great control over methods and procedures. 98.2 percent claim to have more maneuver field to balance work with personal life. 45 percent are attracted to this work due to salary. Other data previously issued by the Hong Kong government show that the average salary of these workers was 22,000 USD between October and December 2024. By comparison, only 37.1 percent earn more than 15,000 USD, showing that they usually receive wages below average. Office employees in Hong Kong usually work from 9am to 6pm during the week and another four hours on Saturdays, which means a total of 49 hours of weekly work. Excluding the break from an hour for lunch from Monday to Friday, exactly 44 hours. Since 53.9 percent of distributors work less than 44 hours per week, it is reasonable that their salaries will be lower than the market average. 98.2 percent of people who make deliveries say they do this service by giving them more room to balance their work with family life. This demonstrates that the new generation pay more attention to the balance between work and personal life, a different phenomenon from the “tele-work” that emerged during the epidemic. The “tele-work” means working from home because it is difficult to evaluate the limit between work and family life. As people working on delivery platforms can control their working hours, the problem of defining the border between work and leisure is very small. The three main limits that define the exercise of labor functions are psychological, temporal and physical. Psychological boundaries are rules created by individuals who determine specific thoughts, behaviors and emotions, which means that one should have a rational attitude when working and an emotional attitude when one is in family. Time limits mean defining working hours, turning off duties outside this time, and dedicating this extra labor time to home and family. The physical limit is defined by the workplace. When you go to the office you will work, when you leave the work ended. The statistical data of delivery platforms show that people choose to collaborate with them mainly because they have more room to control their hours and work model. This phenomenon indicates that the new generation values ​​the existence of boundaries to work time and, in terms of psychological limits, seeks to have more control over their work. In the post-epicide era, it is given greater importance to the balance between professional and family career. Limits theory helps companies understand and better manage work and family boundaries, thus achieving better balance and allowing workers' quality of life to improve. In Hong Kong, delivery platform distributors earn less. Although it has a better notion of the limits of work and a happier family life, material goods that can give to the family are limited. These workers need to achieve balance between family life and material goods. From a business point of view, giving workers more space and flexibility, as well as broader borders, will help recruit a new generation of employees. item.title: AFA | Autumn Hall prolonged because of Hong Kong's Art Basel
item.description:

Thus, the public can see, until next Monday, 30, various works of artists such as Ung Vai Meng or Carlos Marreiros, among others
It takes place in the region neighboring Art Basel de Hong Kong, one of the largest art fairs in the world, and for Macau not to lose the rhythm of the art, AFA - Art for All Society, has decided to extend the deadlines for the fall of the fall lounge, which this year celebrates the 15th edition this year. The extension of the autumn hall, patent at Parisian venture in Cotai, thus allows “offering a unique opportunity to international art enthusiasts visiting Hong Kong for the dynamic art scene that is flourishing in Macao,” says a statement. This year's edition "offers an attractive juxtaposition of art and commerce, echoing the spirit of the original 'Salon d'Amaro" created in the early twentieth century in France. " More than 200 works of 116 artists are available, "selected from an unprecedented number of candidates," including "a diversified range of artistic media, from traditional Chinese painting and oil painting to state -of -the -art digital art, 3D modeling and video installations." Thus, “art lovers from around the world are invited to explore the various creative expressions that flourish in Macao,” reads the same note. item.title: PJ | Goldsmiths were facade for money exchanges
item.description:
The Judicial Police dismantled two criminal groups of illegal money exchange on Tuesday. Of the largest group, which used eight goldsmiths as a facade were arrested 33 people, seized 18 million dollars from Hong Kong. PJ estimates that the group, which has been operating since 2019, will have changed funds equivalent to 590 million Patacas
The Judicial Police (PJ) dismantled two criminal groups on Tuesday who were dedicated to changing Renminbis to Hong Kong dollars. The largest case, which was the focus of a PJ press conference yesterday, concerns a group that had been operating since 2019. Authorities have detained 33 people, 22 local and 11 residents of China, and seized about 18 million dollars from Hong Kong (HKD) in cash, some game sheets, 48 ​​electronic devices and 12 accounting and false transaction books that put the group's operations to the naked. Since the beginning of the scheme, which began in 2019 with advanced capital by the group's head, will have earned more than 20 million patacas in illegal profits following the change of money in an approximately 590 million patacas. According to details of the PJ investigation, quoted by the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the group wore eight jewelery located in the vicinity of Casinos no Cotai as a facade to exchange money to play at the gambling tables. The scheme was to find gamblers, lead them to stores where they simulated the purchase of products, with the transactions recorded in fake taping of jewelery to hide the illegal money exchange. In both directions The PJ added that the group in addition to offering Hong Kong dollars after receiving the bank transfer from players, if they were lucky at the game tables could resort to false jewelery to switch back to renminbis via bank transfer. Tuesday's operation mobilized about 80 criminal investigators, who separated among the various jewelery involved, as well as pledge houses, a office in a mall and several homes. It was added yesterday that the group had a narrow connection with a clandestine bank in the North Zone of the Macao Peninsula, which collaborated in operations in the transfer and circulation of money, with a view to escaping the supervision of the authorities. The group's profits were found based on the variation of exchange rates. Authorities have indicated that they will continue to investigate the source and flow of the capital and seek suspects that have not been arrested now. The PJ announced yesterday that it also dismantled another group of criminals dedicated to the same type of offense, which will have changed about 200 million HKD and found 1 million HKD in improper profits.
